Introduction.description: React Native is a popular framework for building native mobile apps using JavaScript and React.
Introduction.notes: React Native enables code sharing between iOS and Android.

Environment Setup.description: To start with React Native, set up Node.js, npm, and install the React Native CLI or use Expo.
Environment Setup.notes: Expo is a great way to get started quickly.

Hello World.description: A simple Hello World app in React Native.

Components.description: Components are the building blocks of a React Native app.
Components.notes: Components can be functional or class-based.

Props.description: Props are used to pass data from parent to child components.

State.description: State is used to manage data that changes over time in a component.
State.notes: State is local to the component.

Styling.description: Styling in React Native is done using JavaScript objects, similar to CSS.
